verses.verse: Lord <WH3068>, remember <WH2142> David <WH1732>, and all his afflictions <WH6031>:
How he swore <WH7650> unto the Lord <WH3068>, and vowed <WH5087> unto the mighty <WH46> God of Jacob <WH3290>;
Surely I will not come <WH935> into the tabernacle <WH168> of my house <WH1004>, nor go up <WH5927> into my bed <WH6210>;
I will not give <WH5414> sleep <WH8153> to my eyes <WH5869>, or slumber <WH8572> to my eyelids <WH6079>,
Until I find out <WH4672> a place <WH4725> for the Lord <WH3068>, a habitation <WH4908> for the mighty <WH46> God of Jacob <WH3290>.
Behold <WH8085>, we heard of it at Ephratah <WH672>: we found <WH4672> it in the fields <WH7704> of the wood <WH3293>.
We will go <WH935> into his tabernacles <WH4908>: we will worship <WH7812> at his footstool <WH1916>.
Arise <WH6965>, O Lord <WH3068>, into your rest <WH4496>; you <WH727>, and the ark of your strength <WH5797>.
Let your priests <WH3548> be clothed <WH3847> with righteousness <WH6664>; and let your saints <WH2623> shout for joy <WH7442>.
For your servant <WH5650> David <WH1732>'s sake turn not away <WH7725> the face <WH6440> of your anointed <WH4899>.
The Lord <WH3068> has sworn <WH7650> in truth <WH571> unto David <WH1732>; he will not turn <WH7725> from it <WH6529>; Of the fruit of your body <WH990> will I set <WH7896> upon your throne <WH3678>.

If your sons <WH1121> will keep <WH8104> my covenant <WH1285> and my testimony <WH5713> that <WH2090> I shall teach <WH3925> them <WH1121>, their sons shall also sit <WH3427> upon your throne <WH3678> for evermore <WH5703>.
For the Lord <WH3068> has chosen <WH977> Zion <WH6726>; he has desired <WH183> it for his habitation <WH4186>.
This is my rest <WH4496> for ever <WH5703>: here will I live <WH3427>; for I have desired it <WH183>.
I will abundantly <WH1288> bless <WH1288> her provision <WH6718>: I will satisfy <WH7646> her poor <WH34> with bread <WH3899>.
I will also clothe <WH3847> her priests <WH3548> with salvation <WH3468>: and her saints <WH2623> shall shout aloud <WH7442> for joy <WH7444>.
There will I make <WH6779> the horn <WH7161> of David <WH1732> to bud <WH6779>: I have ordained <WH6186> a lamp <WH5216> for my anointed <WH4899>.
His enemies <WH341> will I clothe <WH3847> with shame <WH1322>: but upon himself shall his crown <WH5145> flourish <WH6692>.
